info.title: Protocol J
info.subtitle: RESTful API for the monitoring and control of endpoint routers

sect1.title: Overview
sect1.para: Messages to the Protocol J routing service are by means of a TCP SOCK_STREAM connection to TCP port 9600 on the host server.

sect2.title: Message Command Syntax
sect2.para: Every message in ProtocolJ is a valid JSON document. A minimally valid message has the form:
JSON objects as well as values may be nested within the body of an operation.

sect2.title: Specifying Time
sect2.para: All time values in ProtocolJ are assumed to be in the UTC timezone, encoded in xs.time format as follows:

row.entry: The hours component of the time, in twenty-four hour format and zero-padded.
The minutes component of the time, zero-padded.
The seconds component of the time, zero-padded.

sect3.title: Examples
sect3.para: The following examples all express the same time (14:30:15 UTC):

sect2.title: ActionEdit
sect2.para: Modify the parameters of an existing action.

sect3.title: Send Syntax
sect3.para: See for the contents of action-fields.

sect3.title: Response Syntax
sect3.para: See for the contents of action-fields.

sect4.title: Send
Response

sect2.title: ActionList
sect2.para: Return a list of configured actions for a given router

row.entry: Scheduled time of action, in xs.time format. See for details.
"true" indicates action is to be executed on indicated day

sect4.title: Response
sect4.literallayout: { "actionlist": { "router": 2, "action0": { "id": 1, "time": "16:00:00Z", "sunday": false, "monday": true, "tuesday": false, "wednesday": false, "thursday": false, "friday": false, "saturday": false, "destination": 4, "destinationName": "DST 4", "source": 4, "sourceName": "SRC 4", "comment": "Take input 4 to output 4" }, "action1": { "id": 2, "time": "16:10:00Z", "sunday": false, "monday": true, "tuesday": false, "wednesday": false, "thursday": false, "friday": false, "saturday": false, "destination": 4, "destinationName": "DST 4", "source": 5, "sourceName": "RDProbe", "comment": "Take input 5 to output 4" } } }

sect2.title: ActivateRoute
sect2.para: Command a crosspoint change

sect3.title: Response Syntax
sect3.para: See the routestat command response in

sect2.title: ActivateSnap
sect2.para: Execute a route snapshot

sect3.title: Response Syntax
sect3.para: See the routestat command response in

sect2.title: DestNames
sect2.para: Return the list of destinations on a given router

row.entry: Free-form description of the host device (Livewire only)
IPv4 address of the host device, in dotted-quad notation (Livewire only)
Hostname of the host device (Livewire only)
Slot number on the host device (Livewire only)

sect4.title: Response

sect2.title: GPIStat
sect2.para: Query the state of one or more GPIs.

row.entry: GPI number (optional). If not given, the response will include all GPIs associated with the specified router.
The endpoint number of the GPI.
Code representing the states of the five lines of the specified GPI, with "h" indicating OFF, and "h" indicating ON.

sect2.title: GPOStat
sect2.para: Query the state of one or more GPOs.

row.entry: GPO number (optional). If not given, the response will include all GPOs associated with the specified router.
The endpoint number of the GPO.
Code representing the states of the five lines of the specified GPO, with "h" indicating OFF, and "h" indicating ON.

sect2.title: MaskGPIStat
sect2.para: Enable or suppress GPIStat notifications.

sect3.title: Response Syntax
sect3.para: No response is sent for this command.

sect2.title: MaskGPOStat
sect2.para: Enable or suppress GPOStat notifications.

sect3.title: Response Syntax
sect3.para: No response is sent for this command.

sect2.title: MaskRouteStat
sect2.para: Enable or suppress RouteStat notifications.

sect3.title: Response Syntax
sect3.para: No response is sent for this command.

sect2.title: MaskStat
sect2.para: Enable or suppress GPIStat, GPOStat and RouteStat notifications.

row.entry: Enable/disable GPIStat, GPOStat and RouteStat notifications

sect3.title: Response Syntax
sect3.para: No response is sent for this command.

sect2.title: Ping
sect2.para: Return a pong object.

sect3.title: Send Syntax
sect3.para: There are no send parameters for the ping command.

row.entry: The datetime when the ping command was received, in xs.dateTime format.

sect2.title: RouterNames
sect2.para: Return a list of available routers.

sect3.title: Send Syntax
sect3.para: There are no send parameters for the RouterNames command.

sect3.title: Response Syntax

row.entry: Type of the router. Can be "Audio" or "GPIO".

sect4.title: Response
sect4.literallayout: { "routernames": { "router": 2, "action0": { "id": 1, "time": "16:00:00-00:00", "sunday": false, "monday": true, "tuesday": false, "wednesday": false, "thursday": false, "friday": false, "saturday": false, "destination": 2, "source": 3, "comment": "Take input 3 to output 2" }, "action1": { "id": 2, "time": "16:10:00-00:00", "sunday": false, "monday": true, "tuesday": false, "wednesday": false, "thursday": false, "friday": false, "saturday": false, "destination": 2, "source": 4, "comment": "Take input 4 to output 2" } } }

sect2.title: RouteStat
sect2.para: Query the state of one or more crosspoints.

row.entry: Destination number (optional). If not given, the response will include all crosspoints associated with the specified router destination.

sect2.title: SnapShots
sect2.para: Return a list of configured snapshots on the given router.

sect2.title: SourceNames
sect2.para: Return the list of sources on a given router

row.entry: Free-form description of the host device (Livewire only)
IPv4 address of the host device, in dotted-quad notation (Livewire only)
Hostname of the host device (Livewire only)
Slot number on the host device (Livewire only)

sect4.title: Response

sect2.title: TriggerGPI
sect2.para: Set the specified virtual GPI's state for a specified duration. (Supported only by virtual GPI devices).

row.entry: The endpoint number of the GPI.
Code representing the states of the five lines of the specified GPI, with "h" indicating OFF, and "l" indicating ON.
The duration to hold the state, in milliseconds. Omitting this parameter, or setting it to 0 indicates that the state is to be held indefinitely.

sect3.title: Response Syntax
sect3.para: See the gpistat command response in

sect2.title: TriggerGPO
sect2.para: Set the specified GPO's state for a specified duration.

row.entry: The endpoint number of the GPO.
Code representing the states of the five lines of the specified GPO, with "h" indicating OFF, and "l" indicating ON.
The duration to hold the state, in milliseconds. Omitting this parameter, or setting it to 0 indicates that the state is to be held indefinitely.

sect3.title: Response Syntax
sect3.para: See the gpostat command response in
